resolution.description: The product is working as designed.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi All,

Trying to run 4 m1.small like this:

{code}
[root@odc-d-06-02 ~]# euca-run-instances -n 4 -m -k sshlogin -t m1.small emi-5a0d1672
{code}

But fails saying:

{code}
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Not enough resources available in all zone for 4): vm instances.
{code}

But I have sufficient capacity spread across 2 clusters

{code}
# euca-describe-availability-zones verbose
AVAILABILITYZONE	cloud4a	10.104.1.212 arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloud4a:cluster:cc1/	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- vm types	free / max   cpu   ram  disk	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.small	0002 / 0004   1    256     5	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- t1.micro	0002 / 0004   1    256     5	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.medium	0002 / 0004   1    512    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.medium	0001 / 0002   2    512    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.large	0001 / 0002   2    512    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.xlarge	0001 / 0002   2   1024    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.xlarge	0001 / 0002   2   2048    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.xlarge	0001 / 0002   2   2048    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m3.xlarge	0000 / 0001   4   2048    15	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.2xlarge	0001 / 0001   2   4096    30	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m3.2xlarge	0000 / 0001   4   4096    30	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cc1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   3072    60	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   4096    60	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- hi1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   6144   120	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cc2.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   6144   120	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cg1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   12288   200	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cr1.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   16384   240	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- hs1.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  48   119808  24000	
AVAILABILITYZONE	cloud4b	10.104.1.213 arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloud4b:cluster:cc2/	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- vm types	free / max   cpu   ram  disk	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.small	0002 / 0004   1    256     5	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- t1.micro	0002 / 0004   1    256     5	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.medium	0002 / 0004   1    512    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.medium	0001 / 0002   2    512    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.large	0001 / 0002   2    512    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.xlarge	0001 / 0002   2   1024    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.xlarge	0001 / 0002   2   2048    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.xlarge	0001 / 0002   2   2048    10	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m3.xlarge	0000 / 0001   4   2048    15	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.2xlarge	0001 / 0001   2   4096    30	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m3.2xlarge	0000 / 0001   4   4096    30	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cc1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   3072    60	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m2.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   4096    60	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- hi1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000   8   6144   120	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cc2.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   6144   120	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cg1.4xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   12288   200	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- cr1.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  16   16384   240	
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- hs1.8xlarge	0000 / 0000  48   119808  24000	
{code}

following is seen in CLC logs

{code}
2014-05-08 03:26:14  INFO | Availability: cc1 -> 2
2014-05-08 03:26:14  INFO | Availability: cc2 -> 2
2014-05-08 03:26:14  INFO | Availability: cc1 -> 2
2014-05-08 03:26:14  INFO | Availability: cc2 -> 2
2014-05-08 03:26:14  INFO | Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{VmControl.component}. Message payload is of type: RunInstancesType
2014-05-08 03:26:14  INFO | Failed to send message RunInstancesType to service EucalyptusRequestQueueSync because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{VmControl.component}. Message payload is of type: RunInstancesType
{code}

Curious to know why it failed when sufficient capacity was available in both clusters combined. Is this something to do with the reservation?

I had expect it work seamlessly as I don't care which cluster the instances goes in (did not specify the "-z" option in euca-run-instances)

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: cannot run required number of instances in multi-cluster
fields.environment:
CLC/UFS - 1
CC/SC - 1
CC/SC - 1
NC - 2
Network - EDGE

comments.body:
I am able to run instances in block of 2 but not 4, also for better clarity I have enough addresses available, please see below

{code}
[root@odc-d-06-02 eucalyptus]# euca-run-instances -n 2 -m -k sshlogin -t m1.small emi-5a0d1672
RESERVATION	r-b29a708d	455296963973	default
INSTANCE	i-9e8d2ad6	emi-5a0d1672		euca-10-105-3-14.eucalyptus.internal	pending	sshlogin	0		m1.small	2014-05-08T10:45:00.915Z	cloud4a				monitoring-enabled	10.105.3.14	10.105.3.14			ebs					hvm			sg-54f5dbd8			
INSTANCE	i-29e13269	emi-5a0d1672		euca-10-105-3-20.eucalyptus.internal	pending	sshlogin	1		m1.small	2014-05-08T10:45:00.946Z	cloud4a				monitoring-enabled	10.105.3.20	10.105.3.20			ebs					hvm			sg-54f5dbd8			
[root@odc-d-06-02 eucalyptus]# euca-run-instances -n 2 -m -k sshlogin -t m1.small emi-5a0d1672
RESERVATION	r-f2dd1796	455296963973	default
INSTANCE	i-d28ccd60	emi-5a0d1672		euca-10-105-3-8.eucalyptus.internal	pending	sshlogin	0		m1.small	2014-05-08T10:45:02.672Z	cloud4b				monitoring-enabled	10.105.3.8	10.105.3.8			ebs					hvm			sg-54f5dbd8			
INSTANCE	i-dea52792	emi-5a0d1672		euca-10-105-3-5.eucalyptus.internal	pending	sshlogin	1		m1.small	2014-05-08T10:45:02.702Z	cloud4b				monitoring-enabled	10.105.3.5	10.105.3.5			ebs					hvm			sg-54f5dbd8			
[root@odc-d-06-02 eucalyptus]# euca-describe-addresses 
[root@odc-d-06-02 eucalyptus]# euca-describe-addresses verbose
ADDRESS	10.104.3.11	i-6ce6c0d9 (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.12	i-56a18731 (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.13	pending (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.14	pending (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.15	pending (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.16	pending (arn:aws:euare::000000000000:user/eucalyptus)	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.17	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.18	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.19	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.20	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.21	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.22	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.23	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.24	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.25	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.26	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.27	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.28	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.29	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.30	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.31	nobody	standard				
ADDRESS	10.104.3.32	nobody	standard
{code}

This behavior is correct -- all of the instances in a given reservation must be able to fit into a single availability zone.

To run four instances regardless of availability zone I recommend running {{euca-run-instances -n 1-4}}, seeing how many instances that creates, and then running it again with a maximum that reflects how many more instances you still need.

Thanks, [~dshekhawat]. Currently, we do not consider it a bug (AWS behaves the same way). Admittedly, this may be a nice feature for a private cloud. I am leaving the dup bug open, which, perhaps, should be converted into a feature request.
